verses.verse: The Ingathering of the Dispersed (Mal 4.2; Eph 5.14) Arise, shine, for your light has come, and the glory of the LORD has risen upon you.
(Isa 4.5; Col 1.13) For darkness shall cover the earth and thick darkness the peoples, but the LORD will arise upon you, and his glory will appear over you.
(v 11|ISA 60:11; Isa 49.6, 23) Nations shall come to your light and kings to the brightness of your dawn.
(Isa 49.18, 20-22) Lift up your eyes and look around; they all gather together; they come to you; your sons shall come from far away, and your daughters shall be carried in their nursesâ€™ arms.

(Ps 34.5; Isa 23.18; 24.14; 61.6) Then you shall see and be radiant; your heart shall thrill and rejoice, (Heb be enlarged) because the abundance of the sea shall be brought to you; the wealth of the nations shall come to you.

(Gen 25.4; Ps 72.10; Isa 42.10; 43.23) A multitude of camels shall cover you, the young camels of Midian and Ephah; all those from Sheba shall come. They shall bring gold and frankincense and shall proclaim the praise of the LORD.

(Gen 25.13; Isa 56.7; Hag 2.7, 9) All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered to you; the rams of Nebaioth shall minister to you; they shall be acceptable on my altar, (Q ms Heb mss Gk Syr Tg: MT will ascend on the favor of my altar) and I will glorify my glorious house.
Who are these that fly like a cloud and like doves to their windows?

(Isa 2.16; 49.22; 55.5; 66.19) For the coastlands shall wait for me, the ships of Tarshish first, to bring your children from far away, their silver and gold with them, for the name of the LORD your God and for the Holy One of Israel, because he has glorified you.
(Isa 49.23; 54.8; Zech 6.15) Foreigners shall build up your walls, and their kings shall minister to you, for in my wrath I struck you down, but in my favor I have had mercy on you.
(vv 5, 18|ISA 60:518; Ps 149.8) Your gates shall always be open; day and night they shall not be shut, so that nations shall bring you their wealth, with their kings led in procession.
(Zech 14.17) For the nation and kingdom that will not serve you shall perish; those nations shall be utterly laid waste.
(1 Chr 28.2; Ps 132.7; Isa 35.2; 41.19) The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, the cypress, the plane, and the pine, to beautify the place of my sanctuary, and I will glorify where my feet rest.

(Isa 49.23; Heb 12.22; Rev 3.9) The descendants of those who oppressed you shall come bending low to you, and all who despised you shall bow down at your feet; they shall call you the City of the LORD, the Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
(Isa 33.8, 9; 65.18; 66.5; Jer 30.17) Whereas you have been forsaken and hated, with no one passing through, I will make you majestic forever, a joy from age to age.
(Isa 49.23; 63.8, 16; 66.11) You shall suck the milk of nations; you shall suck the breasts of kings, and you shall know that I, the LORD, am your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
Instead of bronze I will bring gold; instead of iron I will bring silver; instead of wood, bronze; instead of stones, iron. I will appoint Peace as your overseer and Righteousness as your taskmaster.
(v 11|ISA 60:11; Isa 26.1; 51.19; 54.14) Violence shall no more be heard in your land, devastation or destruction within your borders; you shall call your walls Salvation and your gates Praise.

God the Glory of Zion (Isa 9.2; Zech 2.5; Rev 21.23; 22.5) The sun shall no longer be your light by day, nor for brightness shall the moon give light to you by night, (Q ms Gk OL Tg: MT lacks by night) but the LORD will be your everlasting light, and your God will be your glory.
(Isa 30.26; 65.19) Your sun shall no more go down or your moon withdraw itself, for the LORD will be your everlasting light, and your days of mourning shall be ended.
(Ps 37.11, 22; Isa 29.23; 45.11; 52.1) Your people shall all be righteous; they shall possess the land forever. They are the shoot that I planted, the work of my hands, so that I might be glorified.
(Isa 51.2) The least of them shall become a clan and the smallest one a mighty nation; I am the LORD; in its time I will accomplish it quickly.
